titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Fahrenheit 9/11 [videorecording] / Lions Gate Films and IFC Films and The Fellowship Adventure Group present a Dog Eat Dog Films production, a film by Michael Moore ; producers, Jim Czarnecki, Kathleen Glynn ; written, produced and directed by Michael Moore.

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Fahrenheit 9/11 [videorecording] / Lions Gate Films and IFC Films and The Fellowship Adventure Group present a Dog Eat Dog Films production, a film by Michael Moore ; producers, Jim Czarnecki, Kathleen Glynn ; written, produced and directed by Michael Moore.

odd.head: Target Audience
odd.p: MPAA rating: R; for some violent and disturbing images, and for language.

odd.head: Publication, Distribution, Etc.
odd.p: Culver City, Calif. : Columbia TriStar Home Entertainment, c2004.

odd.head: Creation/Production Credits
odd.p: Camera, Mike Desjarlais ; editors, Kurt Engfehr, Christopher Seward, T. Woody Richman ; music, Jeff Gibbs.

odd.head: Participant or Performer
odd.p: Michael Moore, James Baker, Al Gore, Tom Dashle, George W. Bush, Condoleezza Rice, Byron Dorgan, Craig Unger, Jack Cloonan, James Moore, Dan Briody, Carol Ashley, Thomas H. Kean, Rosemary Dillard, Richard Clarke, Martha Brill Olcott, Jim McDermott, Porter Goss, John Conyers, Tammy Baldwin, Lila Lipscomb.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Special features: "The release of 'Fahrenheit 9/11'" featurette; montage: the people of Iraq on the eve of invasion; new scene: Homeland Security, Miami style; outside Abu Ghraib Prison; Eyewitness account from Samara, Iraq; Extended interview with Abdul Henderson; Ella Lipscomb at the Washington, D.C. premiere; Arab-American comediens - their acts and experiences after 9/11; Condoleezza Rice's 9/11 Commission Testimony; Rose Garden press briefing after 9/11 Commission appearance.

archdesc.scopecontent: Through actual footage, interviews, and declassified documents, Michael Moore illustrates the connections President Bush has to the royal house of Saud of Saudia Arabia and the bin Laden's, how the president got elected on fraudulent circumstances and then proceeded to blunder through his duties while ignoring warnings of the looming betrayal by his foreign partners. When the treachery hits with the 9/11 attacks, Moore explains how Bush failed to take immediate action to defend the nation.

subject.term: Video recordings for the hearing impaired.
